author: Douglas A. MacDonald, Ph.D.

resources.description: This is the dataset which includes item and scale level scores for Spirituality Adjective List (SAL) and dimension scores for Expressions of Spirituality Inventory-Revised (ESI-R) for American, Ugandan, and Indian samples. These data were used for analyses reported in a study by MacDonald, Friedman, Brewczynski, Holland, Salagame, Mohan, Gubrij, & Cheong (2015) entitled "Spirituality as a Scientific Construct: Testing its Universality across Cultures and Languages" Dataset also includes information on age, sex, and religious affiliation for all cases.
resources.name: ESISAL.SAV

resources.description: This data set contains item and scale level score information for the Expressions of Spirituality Inventory Revised (ESI-R) for 4004 cases across eight different countries. It also contains demographic information including age, sex, and religious affiliation. These data were used in a study by MacDonald, Friedman, Brewczynski, Holland, Salagame, Mohan, Gubrij, & Cheong (2015) entitled "Spirituality as a Scientific Construct: Testing its Universality across Cultures and Languages." All data are fully coded, labelled and ready to use for reanalysis (this includes recoding of ESI-R items which were reverse scored- this is already done to the relevant items in the dataset).
resources.name: ESIMAIN.SAV

organization.description: This organization was founded and is administered by Dr. Douglas A. MacDonald. Datasets that are on this site are or were used in published research by MacDonald and are made available here so that interested researchers have the opportunity for reanalysis.
organization.title: MacDonald Research
organization.name: macdonald-research

name: spirituality-across-cultures-and-languages-data-sets
notes: These two SPSS datasets provide all data that were used in a study by MacDonald, Friedman, Brewczynski, Holland, Salagame, Mohan, Gubrij, & Cheong (2015) entitled "Spirituality as a Scientific Construct: Testing its Universality across Cultures and Languages." The dataset with the filename ESIMAIN.sav contains all item and scale level score information for the Expressions of Spirituality Inventory Revised (ESI-R) for 4004 cases across eight different countries. It also contains demographic information including age, sex, and religious affiliation. The second dataset with the filename ESISAL.sav contains item and scale level data for the Spirituality Adjective List (SAL) and the scale scores for the ESI-R for samples of respondents from three different countries (i.e., United States, Uganda, and India). For both datasets, all data are fully coded, labelled, and ready to use for reanalysis (this includes recoding of ESI-R items which were reverse scored- this is already done to the relevant items in the dataset).
title: Spirituality Across Cultures and Languages- Data
